args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor chapter 21 of the main campaign.
I want to hear more stories today, Uranus!
You never tire of them, do you, child?
I've made all manner of new discoveries\nbecause of your wisdom. Please, you must\nteach me more!
Very well, my pactbound child. I will\nconfer my knowledge upon you once more.
I look forward to seeing what you do with\nit and how it evolves through you.
The Radiant City, Chanzelia\nPalace Guest Room
Hmm... I must have fallen asleep\nWhat a nostalgic dream that was.

Mmm. Blood. Taking into account my
ragged breathing, chest pain, and
discoloration of skin, I estimate my lungs
to be 30 percent decayed.
(So this is the end that awaits the puppet\nof the Progenitor, is it?)

(Though really I should be happy I've
lasted as long as I have. The Progenitor
did say the wyrmscale made me a solid
vessel.)
How painfully ironic. With my disease now\ncured, I still can't escape the grim clutches\nof death.
It was avarice that led to the resurrection\nof the Progenitor, and this must be my\npunishment for it.
Merely tired from the long journey here.
Thankfully, this bedroom you provided\nafforded me some much needed rest.
Well, that's good to hear—but I doubt a\nsoft bed will be enough to heal the most\nfundamental problem with your body.
Clearly the aftereffects of being used by\nthe Progenitor are enacting a terrible toll.
I really cannot hide anything from you.\nAlas, you are correct: my body is\nbeginning to shut down.
Such sadness ill suits you, my sister.\nI brought this on myself, so keep your\nsympathy for others who have need of it.
Go to the Halidom, most likely.
I hear tell that our younger brother has\ncalled researchers of all sorts to his side.
Perhaps our combined talents can find a\nway to beat back the Progenitor's threat.
THAT'S what you plan to do in your\nweakened condition? You really ought\nto take better care of yourself.
It is precisely BECAUSE of my weakened\ncondition that I must go; I doubt I'll live\nlong enough to see the final battle.
I want to atone for my actions, so if I can\nleave behind research that helps in the\nwar to come, I aim to do so.
My fear of death caused me to fall under\nthe Progenitor's sway, which is why we\nnow find ourselves in this unholy mess.
The world should not have to pay the\nprice for my own egotism.
Harsh, but fair. As royalty, we must each\ntake responsibility for our own actions.
Though speaking of our family line,\nwhat happened to your pactwyrm?
I'm certain you remember how the Other\nwas able to use Zodiark while he\npossessed our father.
I figured the same was true of the\nProgenitor and Uranus, but have\nheard nothing of his fate.
He is dead—killed by my own hands.
You know I was experimenting on how\nto alter a dragon through black mana, yes?\nWell, Uranus... He was my test subject.
And as it was my first experiment,\nI did not hold back.
He proved unable to withstand the\nblack mana.

But Uranus was no mere pactwyrm—
he was your mentor and friend! In fact,
I remember him teaching you a great
many things.
Indeed, I learned more from him than I\never could have gleaned from any book.\nHis mind was...fascinating.
I also heard you once saved his life!
(I thought I heard something groaning\nover here...)
(A dragon! And what is this next to it?)
Do not trouble yourself with me, human...\nMy body is being ravaged by an...\nunknown poison...
Hmm... I recognize this fragment from a\nbook I read about ancient weaponry. Have\nyou somehow awakened an ancient relic?
I reduced it to dust... But I did not expect\nit to contain a poison capable of harming\na mighty dragon... GRAAAAAGH!
Keep still, dragon; I know how to craft\nan antidote for this poison.
Wait here. I will bring it to you.
Phares, the second scion of Alberia.
...After you nursed him back to health,\nthe two of you became pactbound, yes?
You gave him life only to take it away in\nsome mad experiment? Such cruelty is\nunthinkable, Brother.
To say I intentionally healed him is not\nquite correct—I merely wanted to test if\nwhat my book said was true.

I have always viewed medical treatment
as just another kind of experiment—
though I'm certain Uranus resented the
way I toyed with his life.

Perhaps you did not mean to harm him.
Perhaps the Progenitor was wielding some
manner of terrible influence that drove you
to such ends.
Who can say? It is true that my body and\nmind were influenced by the Progenitor...
But even so, I am not free of blame;\nI have ever been unable to control the\ncuriosity that rages inside of me.
Additionally, my heart has harbored a kind\nof resentment against dragons ever since I\nwas diagnosed with wyrmscale.
That is why I distanced myself from\nUranus, and harbored neither guilt nor\nsadness over the way I abused him.
I am an incredibly selfish man—so selfish\nthat I destroyed my own mentor simply to\nfulfill my own twisted desires.
All of that to say Uranus will not be a\nproblem for us in the coming battle.
Yes, well, I should take my leave soon.\nI wish you good health, Sister.
*pant* *pant* I can...still make it....\nI still have time.
(My greatest sin was making light of life,\nand I will gladly accept any punishment\nfor that.)
(But I cannot stand aside and let the world\nbear what is rightfully my own suffering.\nI must make haste!)
This is the first time I've met many of you,\nbut now is not the time for pleasantries.
Our great battle against the Progenitor\nis nigh, yet there remains much we do\nnot understand about our foe.

I care not what field of research you
choose or what methods you use; I ask 
only that you share aught which might be
of assistance in laying low our great foe.
Will you do this thing, my new friends?\nWill you lend me your aid?
(I just need a little more time...\nI must hold out until the last battle!)
